metadata.title: CVE-2018-9518 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In nfc_llcp_build_sdreq_tlv of llcp_commands.c, there is a possible out ofbounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to localescalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. Userinteraction is not needed for exploitation. Product: Android. Versions:Android kernel. Android ID: A-73083945.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-9518` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-130-generic - 4.4.0-130.156
linux-image-4.4.0-130-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-130.156
linux-image-4.4.0-130-lowlatency - 4.4.0-130.156
linux-image-4.4.0-130-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-130.156
linux-image-4.4.0-130-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-130.156
linux-image-4.4.0-130-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-130.156
linux-image-4.4.0-130-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-130.156
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-130-generic - 4.4.0-130.156
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1092-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1092.100
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-34-generic - 4.15.0-34.37~16.04.1

linux-image-4.15.0-34-lowlatency - 4.15.0-34.37~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-34-generic - 4.15.0-34.37~16.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-130.156').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
